â
The Nouveau driver has been used as the default open-source driver for Nvidia cards in the [[Fedora 11]] distribution of [[Linux]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.phoronix.com/scan.php?page=news_item&px=NzE3OA|title=Testing Out The Nouveau Driver On Fedora 11}}</ref> It is also included in the repository (but not enabled by default) of [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] Jaunty<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.phoronix.com/scan.php?page=news_item&px=NjkxNg|title=Ubuntu 9.04 To Get Nouveau Driver}}</ref> and in the experimental repository of [[Debian]] Sid<ref>{{cite web|url=http://chris-lamb.co.uk/2008/07/16/nouveau-nvidia-drivers-now-available-in-debian-experimental|title= Nouveau nVidia drivers now available in Debian experimental}}</ref>.
+
The Nouveau driver has been used as the default open-source driver for Nvidia cards in the [[Fedora 11]] distribution of [[Linux]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.phoronix.com/scan.php?page=news_item&px=NzE3OA|title=Testing Out The Nouveau Driver On Fedora 11}}</ref> It is also included in the repository (but not enabled by default) of [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] 9.04<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.phoronix.com/scan.php?page=news_item&px=NjkxNg|title=Ubuntu 9.04 To Get Nouveau Driver}}</ref> and in the experimental repository of [[Debian]] Sid<ref>{{cite web|url=http://chris-lamb.co.uk/2008/07/16/nouveau-nvidia-drivers-now-available-in-debian-experimental|title= Nouveau nVidia drivers now available in Debian experimental}}</ref>.
On 10 December 2009 nouveau was accepted in the [[Linux kernel]] as a staging driver.<ref>[http://www.phoronix.com/scan.php?page=news_item&px=Nzc5NQ Nouveau To Go Into Linux 2.6.33 Kernel!], phoronix, December 11, 2009</ref>
On 10 December 2009 nouveau was accepted in the [[Linux kernel]] as a staging driver.<ref>[http://www.phoronix.com/scan.php?page=news_item&px=Nzc5NQ Nouveau To Go Into Linux 2.6.33 Kernel!], phoronix, December 11, 2009</ref>
